Detailed Description

Handles the interaction with the sqlite3 database.

Author:
Keith Woelke
Date:
25/07/2010

Function Documentation

sqlite3* db_connect ( char *  dbName  ) 

Create a connection to the sqlite3 database.

Enables foreign keys as a default action.

Parameters:
dbName the name of the sqlite3 database file.
conn a pointer to an sqlite3 connection handle will be returned through this parameter. Parameter will be NULL if a connection could not be established.
Returns:
an integer representing the error code as returned by sqlite3_open_v2.
int db_disable_foreign_keys ( sqlite3 *  conn  ) 

Disable foreign keys for a sqlite3 connection.

Parameters:
conn a connection handle to a sqlite3 database.
Returns:
an integer representing the error code as returned by sqlite3_exec.
int db_disconnect ( sqlite3 *  conn  ) 

Close a sqlite3 database connection.

Parameters:
conn a connection handle to a sqlite3 database.
Returns:
an integer representing the error code as returned by sqlite3_close.
int db_enable_foreign_keys ( sqlite3 *  conn  ) 

Enable foreign keys for a sqlite3 connection.

Parameters:
conn a connection handle to a sqlite3 database.
Returns:
an integer representing the error code as returned by sqlite3_exec.
bool db_valid_tag ( char *  tag  ) 

Determines if a given tag exists in the database already.

Parameters:
tag the tag to check for within the database.
Returns:
true, if the tag exists in the database. false, if the tag does not exist in the database.
